body:
@wangzzu I would like this feature in a following task, to support both from/to timestamp/offset.

Create https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CALCITE-3073 for tracking.

@DonnyZone 
You can
```shell
git config --global user.email "your github email" 
```
then Your commit avatar will show highlights.
LGTM.
@ambition119 thanks for reminder
Update to fix build fail.
Update to resolve conflicts.

Please:
* fix build fail
* squash commits to one
* change the commit message to '[CALCITE-2601] Add REVERSE function ( your jira id)'
@danny0405 could you please review this PR? Thanks a lot.
@XuMingmin :+1:

> Please:
> 
> * fix build fail

I PR `mvn clean install` build success, now I can observe that I have submitted the failed display, and 
**AppVeyor**  did not pull the code to **check** and **build**, thank you.

> * squash commits to one

done.

> * change the commit message to '[CALCITE-2601] Add REVERSE function ( your jira id)'

done.
Is conflicts lead `AppVeyor was unable to build `?  If I resolved the conflicts, then it’s not good to go to squash commits to one.  thanks
The error says `AppVeyor was unable to build non-mergable pull request`. So you should resolve conflicts first. BTW, you commit message is `LCITE-2601] Add REVERSE function`. Please correct it.

> The error says `AppVeyor was unable to build non-mergable pull request`. So you should resolve conflicts first. BTW, you commit message is `LCITE-2601] Add REVERSE function`. Please correct it.

thanks
Squash commits and update the commit message.
Ping!

> Does Correlate still work after the change? It looks like EnumerableCorrelate is no longer in the plans.

The correlate still works.
Also, please add and verify the email address used in your commit on GitHub. See the https://help.github.com/en/articles/verifying-your-email-address.
+1, LGMT
hi @chunweilei @pengzhiwei2018 @julianhyde @danny0405 @zhztheplayer  Thank you very much，Comments addressed.
hi @hsyuan @chunweilei @zhztheplayer @danny0405 @pengzhiwei2018  Thank you very much，Comments addressed.
hi @hsyuan @zhztheplayer @danny0405 @pengzhiwei2018 @chunweilei  Thank you very much，Comments addressed.
Also please resolve conflicts and squash commits.
Squash commits.
close and opened #1219

> Also please resolve conflicts and squash commits.

Thank you for your reminders and suggestions, because I am merge apache/master into origin/reverse_fun, so now squash commits is more troublesome, these commit code enter this PR, such as Files changed is not 8 but 64, this already has a comment description(`Is conflicts lead AppVeyor was unable to build ? If I resolved the conflicts, then it’s not good to go to squash commits to one. thanks`).
```shell
pick 62cf3d1dc [CALCITE-2601] Add REVERSE function
pick d0a06f786 [CALCITE-3061] Query with WITH clause fails when alias is the same as the table with rolled up column
pick c25b29c0c [CALCITE-2803] ProjectTransposeJoinRule messes INDF expressions
pick 2a2140f98 Site: Add Danny Chan as committer
pick b039a36a3 [CALCITE-3034] CSV test case description does not match it's code logic (FaxianZhao)
pick 3f24710db [CALCITE-2936] Simplify EXISTS or NOT EXISTS sub-query that has "GROUP BY ()"
pick e98c779d1 [CALCITE-3017] Improve null handling of JsonValueExpressionOperator
pick a5b382abb [CALCITE-3028] Support FULL OUTER JOIN with AggregateJoinTransposeRule (Vineet Garg)
pick d6896202c [CALCITE-3066] RelToSqlConverter may incorrectly throw an AssertionError for some decimal literals
pick 046bb81a9 [CALCITE-3052] Error while applying rule MaterializedViewAggregateRule(Project-Aggregate): ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
pick 051058be8 [CALCITE-2282] Remove sql operator table from parser
pick 7df06784a [CALCITE-2933] Add timestamp extract for casts from timestamp type to other types
pick 999c41d5f [CALCITE-2975] Implement JSON_REMOVE function (xuqianjin)
pick c6b6800c2 [CALCITE-3062] Do not populate provenanceMap if not debug
pick ca92ce27c [CALCITE-3074] Move MySQL's JSON operators to SqlLibraryOperators
pick 4d0477305 [CALCITE-2965] Implement string functions: REPEAT, SPACE, SOUNDEX, DIFFERENCE
pick cc73fe525 merge conflicts
pick 020c60bad fix doc
```
By the way, this is not my first PR, The code that has been merged is https://github.com/apache/calcite/blob/master/server/src/main/java/org/apache/calcite/sql/ddl/SqlCreateFunction.java  Of course, if any of the committers can help me reset the Author in that PR, I will be very happy, thank you!
Besides of the unit test, we should add a ITCase also comes from the sql.
@ambition119 you should use `--rebase` when you try to merge master to your branch. I will try to merge this PR.

> @ambition119 you should use `--rebase` when you try to merge master to your branch. I will try to merge this PR.

thanks, I use 
```
$ git rebase -i HEAD~4
```
then merge master,  but the commit(like pick xx fix doc) after the merge is difficult to `--rebase`.
You can checkout a new branch from master and cherry-pick some commits from this branch. Then delete this branch and rename the new branch to this branch name. Finally, you force push the new branch.

> You can checkout a new branch from master and cherry-pick some commits from this branch. Then delete this branch and rename the new branch to this branch name. Finally, you force push the new branch.

Thank you for your advice, I will try and understand this development process. My usual development operation is
```shell
1. git clone https://github.com/<Github_user>/calcite.git
2. $ git remote add apache https://github.com/apache/calcite
3. $ git fetch apache
    $ git rebase apache/master
    $ git push   
4. $ git checkout -b reverse_fun
```
then dev and commit,  and squash commits is 
```shell
$ git rebase -i HEAD~5
$ git push --force
```
Can you add your WeChat?   my wechat is 358998716, thanks.

You almost do the right thing. I think you may wrong only when you resolve conflicts. You should:
```
git checkout master
git fetch apache
git merge apache/master
git push origin master
git checkout dev_branch
git pull --rebase origin master
```

Thanks for reviewing. I modified the code as per provided comments.

> Pls add a JIRA ticket and prefix git comment with it. Example
>> [CALCITE-1234] Upgrade elastic search to 7.x (FirstName LastName)

Sure I will squash all commits before merging.

@LastSmile732, could you please add and verify the email address used (shawn.chen@geminidata.com) in your commit to your GitHub account? Or you can change the commit email address to another that is already verified by command `git commit --amend --author="user name <user email address>"`.

@shimamoto overall LGTM. Thanks for your work on this upgrade. 
Pls rebase into single commit.
@zhztheplayer, Sure, it's done, sorry I didn't notice the email address I use for commits is work email, I just added and verified it with my GitHub. Thanks for your reminder.
@ambition119 could you please review https://github.com/chunweilei/calcite/commit/b9c3e33b7174941e8cf0c25af29430114f50fce4? If no other comments, I would like to merge it.

> @ambition119 could you please review [chunweilei@b9c3e33](https://github.com/chunweilei/calcite/commit/b9c3e33b7174941e8cf0c25af29430114f50fce4)? If no other comments, I would like to merge it.

Wait a moment, I submit a test code for you to see. Thank you！

> @ambition119 could you please review [chunweilei@b9c3e33](https://github.com/chunweilei/calcite/commit/b9c3e33b7174941e8cf0c25af29430114f50fce4)? If no other comments, I would like to merge it.

@chunweilei Thank you for your help and processing,  the [chunweilei@b9c3e33](https://github.com/chunweilei/calcite/commit/b9c3e33b7174941e8cf0c25af29430114f50fce4) is no problem, just added the add reverse jdbc test in testJdbcFn(), thank you!
@asereda-gs Squashed all commits!

> Besides of the unit test, we should add a ITCase also comes from the sql.

There is discussion in the JIRA with respect to this. I am not sure if it will be easy to reproduce but let's at least understand why.
Thanks for reviewing this PR. As I don't have enough bandwidth on it. I will close this PR and anyone who is interested could take this JIRA.

Hi @amaliujia, I think the PR is close to being merged so I am re-opening it since I don't want you to lose the credit for your work so far. This does not mean that you are obliged to participate in the discussion or respond to the comments. Me or another reviewer may handle the things that are left. If it turns out that something big is missing we may close it in the future. Thanks again for working on this!
I think that history.md should also be updated regarding the backward incompatible changes!
@zabetak should it be part of `1.20` release notes ?
@asereda-gs Breaking changes are usually part of the release note so I would say yes. I guess the comment you send in the dev list suffices.

@xpleaf will you have time to address comments in the review ? 
We plan to release `1.20` in 10 days.

Pls change commit to say 
> [CALCITE-3027] Elasticsearch Adapter. Support LIKE operator (FirstName LastName)
Thanks for raising this. I am wondering if you can file another jira for this.

> Thanks for raising this. I am wondering if you can file another jira for this.

thanks, I can create new jira.

@walterddr 
You can
```shell
git config --global user.email "your github email" 
```
then Your commit avatar will show highlights.
LGTM
good tip @ambition119 . I actually changed my email address on website setting, but forgot to update the global config :-) wilco
Thanks @Aaaaaaron for your contribution. Please follow guidelines at http://calcite.apache.org/develop/ regarding contributing code (for example your commit message is not following the guidelines).
Opened a new PR for this(https://github.com/apache/calcite/pull/1227).
Please add your id in the end of commit message like `[CALCITE-3084] xxxx (you jira id)`.

> Please add your id in the end of commit message like `[CALCITE-3084] xxxx (you jira id)`.

my jira is CALCITE-3084, title info is 'Implement JDBC string functions: ASCII, REPEAT, SPACE, SOUNDEX, DIFFERENCE';

my commit message is 
```shell
$ git log -2
[CALCITE-3084] Implement JDBC string functions: ASCII, REPEAT, SPACE, SOUNDEX, DIFFERENCE
```
Because the message is too long, so it looks like there is a middle `…
…`, thanks.

@ambition119 What i mean is you should add your jira id as follows:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37774589/58233309-4d674980-7d6e-11e9-8c7f-b07c15e3aef8.png)
You can find more about contributing in https://calcite.apache.org/develop/#contributing.

> You can find more about contributing in https://calcite.apache.org/develop/#contributing.

oh, thanks.

hi @julianhyde @chunweilei @pengzhiwei2018  Thank you very much.I now found an error when adding JDBC String function `{fn LEFT(string, integer)` and `{fn RIGHT(string, integer)}` create in `SqlJdbcFunctionCall` and test in `SqlOperatorBaseTest.testJdbcFn()`.It looks like there's a conflict between String's `LEFT` semantics and `LEFT JOIN` semantics.I am not sure how to solve this problem. Could you give me some advice?
best
qianjin
I see high-level discussions about scheduling and dependency on CALCITE-3080 going on here. As I said previously, please have these discussions in JIRA not git.
Let's discuss in JIRA.
I forget to rebase, close it first

@asereda-gs rebased from apache/master. 
@julianhyde , thanks for reminding, let me copy the thread to JIRA.

> I don't think other projects have it. I guess Maven figures it out somehow?

I believe the default configuration would allow SNAPSHOTs from central. This is a bit more aggressive to prevent us from ever pulling a SNAPSHOT from central (which I think is laudable). Thanks for the careful eye!
@hsyuan can you point this convention to me as I'm not aware of it? According to http://calcite.apache.org/develop/, the message has to be concise and in case of small bug, just mention the bug.

It is not described in the link. I remember I had been reminded several times do not add 'Fix' in the title.
But anyway, it is not a big deal.
@DonnyZone Can you change the commit messages?
Copy of #523, since the original pull request seems to be stalled. @minji-kim @michaelmior let me know if you're okay with this.
Done.
There are 2 commits, can you squash?
Sorry for bringing trouble. In weekend outing, I will cope with it the day after tomorrow.
Per https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CALCITE-2889, this PR is half of feature. The full feature is support varargs in UDF. Will close this PR.
@danny0405 , since we have dropped the use of merge commit for our repository, are you able to redo your changes as some normal commits? I think it should help with code review also.
Thanks @zhztheplayer , i would rebase and do some little refactor for this patch.

> Also can you please rebase against latest master ? I want to make sure build doesn't fail.

Hello, @asereda-gs  thanks for you review, I made some changes according to your comments and rebase against latest master. Do you have time to have a look at the PR again?
@vlsi, I've addressed your comments. Please, take a look again.
@pengzhiwei2018 Could you take a look at the conflicts here?

> @pengzhiwei2018 Could you take a look at the conflicts here?



> @pengzhiwei2018 Could you take a look at the conflicts here?

Thanks for start this review! Done for it!

Thanks for the changes @leesf. And could you please add a unit test to guard against large result set? Now that the fetch size in Avatica is defaulted to 100[1]. You can make the rows of return larger than the number.

[1] https://github.com/apache/calcite-avatica/blob/96507bfe737f2188c16dec9d16d5e8b502df231f/core/src/main/java/org/apache/calcite/avatica/AvaticaStatement.java#L40
Reviewing now.

Has this issue shown up empirically?

The stack is implemented as an `ArrayDeque`, so push and pop should be very few machine instructions.

`RelShuttleImpl` is not the only possible implementation of `RelShuttle`. It is just a good general-purpose implementation. If it doesn't meet your needs, you can create your own.

No sub-classes in Calcite use the `stack` field, but it's there, and it is potentially useful, if I am looking for say a `Filter` within a `Project` within a `Filter`.

Consider `AbstractList` class in the JDK. It contains a `modCount` field is useful for most implementations (prevents concurrent modifications) but is unnecessary overhead for sub-classes that are immutable. To avoid that overhead, I created `AbstractImmutableList`, but I wouldn't suggest removing `modCount` from `AbstractList`.
Can you create a JIRA case for this, please? In JIRA, add a link to this PR.
Made jira case, took suggestion above.

You wrote `operand.unparse(writer, getLeftPrec() + 1, getRightPrec() + 1)` but it seems that `operand.unparse(writer, getLeftPrec(), getRightPrec())` is sufficient to pass the test case.

This is usually the case. Whatever is inside the operand just needs to use enough parentheses (or whatever) sufficient to overcome the gravitational attraction of whatever is surrounding it.

I'll fix up, unless you object.
No objections! Take it away 😄!
hi @zhztheplayer Thank you very much，Comments addressed.
rebased.
Reviewing now. Please see comments in the JIRA case.

> Reviewing now. Please see comments in the JIRA case.

Thanks for reviewing. The build is passing. We can merge this along with your revision or I can cherry-pick your commit and update this PR
Left comments in JIRA.
Should we use `improve` since `improvement` is a noun?
Can you please move the function to `SqlLibraryOperators` ?
@mikehinchey I have modified it.
The PR is merged but somehow the commit message is not consistent with issue title (probably by my mistake during rebasing). Will perform a force push to correct shortly.
@walterddr Could you take a look at the conflict that has been introduced?
